page.title: 04Grafham Reservoir,Statistics
page.content: In 1966 the reservoir was fully flooded and now provides water to over a million people living in Bedfordshire, Cambridgeshire, Hertfordshire and Northamptonshire. {Anglian Water Authority}are the managing authority of the reservoir, treatment, pumping and pipelines.They provide 50 million gallons of water a day and can store 13000 million gallons . The area of the reservoir at the top water level is 1570 acres or two and a half square miles of water. It is 144 feet above sea level and is 21 metres deep at its greatest depth. The water is abstracted from the{ {River Great Ouse}at a point near { {Offord}pumped four miles underground, then lifted approximately 100 feet into the reservoir. The perimeter of the reservoir is 10 miles.
